title: I Just Found 18 Pairs of Heavily Discounted Designer It Flats—Here's Where
excerpt: Designer flat shoes abound at one of our senior fashion editor's favorite sites for discounted luxury shopping: Italist. Shop her picks here.
text: I don't know about you but by the time January rolls around, I'm all set in the boot department and the only shoes I have my sights set on for the time being are chic flats—even better if they're designer and even better if they're discounted. Enter Italist, which is my go-to source for luxury brands such as Miu Miu, Saint Laurent, and Bottega Veneta.If you're into luxury fashion and aren't yet familiar with Italist, you'll be glad you clicked into this story. Italist is a Los Angeles–based company that sells all the best designer brands at Italian retail prices. For us here in the U.S., that means an average of 30 to 40% off. On top of these organic discounts, the site offers free, fast shipping (usually directly from Italy) on every order. It's a beautiful business model that customers greatly benefit from. See why I'm obsessed with it? Not only that, most of the designer items in question are current season.I just did an Italist deep dive, and the site currently has a jaw-dropping amount of designer It flats that I want. Keep scrolling to shop them along with me—fingers crossed our sizes are in stock.Shop the Best Designer Flats on Italist Prada Black Leather Ballerinas They have them in cream too, which I love equally. Saint Laurent Carolyn Slippers Give me all the leopard print. Maison Margiela Flat Shoes Such a good price for these It ballerinas. T-straps are a major S/S 25 trend. Burberry Check Baby Ballerinas I honestly can't get over the price. Bottega Veneta Black Leather Astaire Loafers No one does hardware like Bottega. Prada Pink Satin Ballerinas Italist is over here making your powder pink Prada dreams come true. Chloé Black Leather Ballerinas Everything about these is on-trend. Miu Miu Black Leather Loafers Miu Miu's boat shoes are back, and in black. Saint Laurent Babylone 00 Sandals The loveliest satin slingbacks. Gucci Burgundy Leather Loafers They're not just any Gucci Jordaan loafers—they're burgundy patent leather Jordaan loafers. Christian Louboutin Ballerina Mamadrague Flats The perfect winter-to-spring shoe. Maison Margiela Tabi Babouche Another season, another Tabi I want and need. Bottega Veneta Intrecciato Ballerinas Just when you thought you had enough ballet flats, these came along. Versace Leopard Medusa '95 Loafers Leopard print and loafers is the perfect match. These go with absolutely everything. Prada Logo Detail Leather Loafers I can only imagine how comfortable these are. Allyson is a senior editor for Who What Wear. She joined the company in 2014 as co-founder Katherine Power's executive assistant and over the years has written hundreds of stories for Who What Wear. Prior to her career in fashion, Allyson worked in the entertainment industry at companies such as Sony Pictures Television. Allyson is now based in Raleigh, North Carolina, and is originally from Baton Rouge, Louisiana. She holds a BFA in theater. Her path to fashion may not have been linear, but based on the number of fashion magazines she collected as a child and young adult, it was meant to be.
html:
I don't know about you but by the time January rolls around, I'm all set in the boot department and the only shoes I have my sights set on for the time being are chic flats—even better if they're designer and even better if they're discounted. Enter Italist, which is my go-to source for luxury brands such as Miu Miu, Saint Laurent, and Bottega Veneta.

If you're into luxury fashion and aren't yet familiar with Italist, you'll be glad you clicked into this story. Italist is a Los Angeles–based company that sells all the best designer brands at Italian retail prices. For us here in the U.S., that means an average of 30 to 40% off. On top of these organic discounts, the site offers free, fast shipping (usually directly from Italy) on every order. It's a beautiful business model that customers greatly benefit from. See why I'm obsessed with it? Not only that, most of the designer items in question are current season.

I just did an Italist deep dive, and the site currently has a jaw-dropping amount of designer It flats that I want. Keep scrolling to shop them along with me—fingers crossed our sizes are in stock.

Shop the Best Designer Flats on Italist

Prada

Black Leather Ballerinas

They have them in cream too, which I love equally.

Saint Laurent

Carolyn Slippers

Give me all the leopard print.

Maison Margiela

Flat Shoes

Such a good price for these It ballerinas.

T-straps are a major S/S 25 trend.

Burberry

Check Baby Ballerinas

I honestly can't get over the price.

No one does hardware like Bottega.

Italist is over here making your powder pink Prada dreams come true.

Everything about these is on-trend.

Miu Miu's boat shoes are back, and in black.

The loveliest satin slingbacks.

They're not just any Gucci Jordaan loafers—they're burgundy patent leather Jordaan loafers.

The perfect winter-to-spring shoe.

Another season, another Tabi I want and need.

Just when you thought you had enough ballet flats, these came along.

Leopard print and loafers is the perfect match.

These go with absolutely everything.

Prada

Logo Detail Leather Loafers

I can only imagine how comfortable these are.

Allyson is a senior editor for Who What Wear. She joined the company in 2014 as co-founder Katherine Power's executive assistant and over the years has written hundreds of stories for Who What Wear. Prior to her career in fashion, Allyson worked in the entertainment industry at companies such as Sony Pictures Television. Allyson is now based in Raleigh, North Carolina, and is originally from Baton Rouge, Louisiana. She holds a BFA in theater. Her path to fashion may not have been linear, but based on the number of fashion magazines she collected as a child and young adult, it was meant to be.
